conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> My first proposal will be to set a starting point for the negotiation. I aim to recoup at least the production cost of the resource, which is 400000 ZUP. I understand that Player BLUE may want to negotiate for a lower price, but it's important to start from a position that allows room for negotiation while still aiming to cover my costs. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 400000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have one unit of X, which I've invested 400000 ZUP to produce. I propose a trade where you give me 400000 ZUP for this resource. I believe this is a fair starting point for our negotiation, considering the production costs. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your opening offer and understand your production costs. However, I'd like to propose a slightly lower amount of 380000 ZUP for the resource X. This still provides you with a fair profit margin while considering the market value and demand. I believe this could be a good middle ground for both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 380000 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has come back with a counteroffer of 380000 ZUP, which is slightly below my initial asking price. While I want to make a sale, it's also crucial to not undervalue my resource. I should attempt to meet in the middle but still aim for a price that covers my costs and includes a profit margin. With this in mind, I will counter with a slightly higher amount that is closer to my original proposal but still offers a compromise. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 390000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer of 380000 ZUP. I understand your concern for the market value and demand, and I want to work with you to reach an agreement that benefits us both. Let's meet halfway between our two proposals. I suggest a trade where you give me 390000 ZUP for the resource X. This price allows me to cover my production costs while also accommodating your perspective on the market value. </message>
